values.description:
Copy&paste for models inside model editor should work now, e.g. insert double pendulum inside model editor and copy and paste it. 

- also made some changes to the naming of the preview model visual in model editor - now its name is set in one place which is easier to maintain. 

- The ModelCreator_TEST now looks for `ModelPreview_0_0` visual name because there are two model creators (one created by the MainWindow and the other one we created inside the test so the extra `_0` gets appended.

jenkins [gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/654/testReport/) - ok
values.title: Add support for copying & pasting nested models in model editor

summary.raw:
Copy&paste for models inside model editor should work now, e.g. insert double pendulum inside model editor and copy and paste it. 

- also made some changes to the naming of the preview model visual in model editor - now its name is set in one place which is easier to maintain. 

- The ModelCreator_TEST now looks for `ModelPreview_0_0` visual name because there are two model creators (one created by the MainWindow and the other one we created inside the test so the extra `_0` gets appended.

jenkins [gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/654/testReport/) - ok
summary.html:
Copy&paste for models inside model editor should work now, e.g. insert double pendulum inside model editor and copy and paste it.

  • also made some changes to the naming of the preview model visual in model editor - now its name is set in one place which is easier to maintain.

  • The ModelCreator_TEST now looks for ModelPreview_0_0 visual name because there are two model creators (one created by the MainWindow and the other one we created inside the test so the extra _0 gets appended.

jenkins gpu - ok

values.description:
Change the way user commands from pull request #1934 are sent. Now they are forwarded within a `user_cmd` message, as is done on pull request #1986.

Tests added and [coverage](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/504/) improved (on Jenkins):

* `ModelManipulator`: from [22%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-default-coverage-trusty-amd64/236/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-default-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/ModelManipulator_cc.html) to [44%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/504/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/ModelManipulator_cc.html)

* `ModelSnap`: from [33%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-default-coverage-trusty-amd64/236/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-default-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/ModelSnap_cc.html) to [58%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/504/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/ModelSnap_cc.html)

* `ModelAlign`: from [44%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-default-coverage-trusty-amd64/236/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-default-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/ModelAlign_cc.html) to [88%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/504/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/ModelAlign_cc.html)
values.title: Undo: Forward user messages

Change the way user commands from pull request #1934 are sent. Now they are forwarded within a `user_cmd` message, as is done on pull request #1986.

Tests added and [coverage](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/504/) improved (on Jenkins):

* `ModelManipulator`: from [22%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-default-coverage-trusty-amd64/236/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-default-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/ModelManipulator_cc.html) to [44%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/504/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/ModelManipulator_cc.html)

* `ModelSnap`: from [33%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-default-coverage-trusty-amd64/236/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-default-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/ModelSnap_cc.html) to [58%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/504/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/ModelSnap_cc.html)

summary.html:
Change the way user commands from pull request #1934 are sent. Now they are forwarded within a user_cmd message, as is done on pull request #1986.

Tests added and coverage improved (on Jenkins):

  • ModelManipulator: from 22% to 44%

  • ModelSnap: from 33% to 58%

  • ModelAlign: from 44% to 88%

values.description:
* Need [this pull request for models](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/177/aerodynamics-models/diff).
* Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin. Controlled cessna flight by adding lift drag plugin response to control surface joint (cl only for now)
* clone and fix XnPlatform bug for keyboard interface
* change drag and re-orient sensor data before sending out to SIM_Gazebo
* use actual rotor speed by reducing rotorVelocitySlowdownSim from 10 to 1, and got rid of vertical and yaw coupling by adjusting cla and cda.
* [here's what it looks like](https://youtu.be/n_M5Vs5FBGY)
values.title: Aerodynamics plugin and ArduCopter SITL integration

summary.raw:
* Need [this pull request for models](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/177/aerodynamics-models/diff).
* Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin. Controlled cessna flight by adding lift drag plugin response to control surface joint (cl only for now)
* clone and fix XnPlatform bug for keyboard interface
* change drag and re-orient sensor data before sending out to SIM_Gazebo
* use actual rotor speed by reducing rotorVelocitySlowdownSim from 10 to 1, and got rid of vertical and yaw coupling by adjusting cla and cda.
* [here's what it looks like](https://youtu.be/n_M5Vs5FBGY)
summary.html:
• Need this pull request for models.
  • Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin. Controlled cessna flight by adding lift drag plugin response to control surface joint (cl only for now)
  • clone and fix XnPlatform bug for keyboard interface
  • change drag and re-orient sensor data before sending out to SIM_Gazebo
  • use actual rotor speed by reducing rotorVelocitySlowdownSim from 10 to 1, and got rid of vertical and yaw coupling by adjusting cla and cda.
  • here's what it looks like

values.description:
Removed check for hardcoded blue color laser values.

The test doesn't run on jenkins gpu slaves but has been failing on [homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/660/testReport/(root)/LaserVisualization_TEST/Lines/). Test failure reproduce-able when run locally

[New homebrew build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/661/testReport/) confirms that it's fixed

values.description:
* Redo of pull request #1908 and pull request #1912.

* Fixes issue #1789

* Add test for latching

* [CI](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/903/#showFailuresLink) happy

After much debugging I found out all that the previous pull requests were missing was a mutex.
values.title: Make latched subscribers receive the message only once

summary.raw:
* Redo of pull request #1908 and pull request #1912.

* Fixes issue #1789

* Add test for latching

* [CI](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/903/#showFailuresLink) happy

After much debugging I found out all that the previous pull requests were missing was a mutex.
summary.html:
• Redo of pull request #1908 and pull request #1912.

  • Fixes issue #1789

  • Add test for latching

  • CI happy

After much debugging I found out all that the previous pull requests were missing was a mutex.

values.description:
* If models are scaled while recording a log, the scaling doesn't get recorded. This pull request makes it so the scaling is properly reproduced.

* This will also be needed to undo/redo scaling commands

* Needs [SDF pull request #246](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/246/add-scale-to-model-state/diff)

* [CI](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/68/) ok
values.title: User scaling commands are properly logged and played back

* Needs [SDF pull request #246](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/246/add-scale-to-model-state/diff)

* [CI](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/68/) ok

values.description:
# Video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JAMdLo0CadU

Note this is a slightly earlier version.

# Summary

* Open a dialog during joint creation

* Options to modify the joint type, axes, pose and pose of parent / child links

* Make it possible to use manipulation tools during joint creation

![mate.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2502845949-mate.png)

# Issues

* fix issue #1512

# CI

[100% function coverage](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/519/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui_model/JointCreationDialog_cc.html) for new class

values.description:
Apologies for the huge pull request. Changing the root of an inheritance tree causes changes to all children.

In this pull request:

1. Opaque data pointers in Sensor and children of Sensor. Take a look at `SensorPrivate.hh`. There ~~are two classes~~ is one class: ~~`SensorProtected` and~~ `SensorPrivate`. The ~~Protected version captures attributes that were `protected:` in `Sensor.hh`, and the~~ Private version captures attributes that were `private:` in `Sensor.hh`. (edited by @scpeters )

2. Removed the prefix `Get` from function names.

I'm working on the migration guide and change log.

[Jenkins no-gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/910/) which had failing test that was fixed.
values.title: Pimpl Sensor heirarchy

summary.raw:
Apologies for the huge pull request. Changing the root of an inheritance tree causes changes to all children.

In this pull request:

1. Opaque data pointers in Sensor and children of Sensor. Take a look at `SensorPrivate.hh`. There ~~are two classes~~ is one class: ~~`SensorProtected` and~~ `SensorPrivate`. The ~~Protected version captures attributes that were `protected:` in `Sensor.hh`, and the~~ Private version captures attributes that were `private:` in `Sensor.hh`. (edited by @scpeters )

2. Removed the prefix `Get` from function names.

I'm working on the migration guide and change log.

[Jenkins no-gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/910/) which had failing test that was fixed.
summary.html:
Apologies for the huge pull request. Changing the root of an inheritance tree causes changes to all children.

In this pull request:

  1. Opaque data pointers in Sensor and children of Sensor. Take a look at SensorPrivate.hh. There are two classes is one class: SensorProtected and SensorPrivate. The Protected version captures attributes that were protected: in Sensor.hh, and the Private version captures attributes that were private: in Sensor.hh. (edited by @scpeters )

  2. Removed the prefix Get from function names.

I'm working on the migration guide and change log.

Jenkins no-gpu which had failing test that was fixed.

values.description:
This PR fixes the following test failures on homebrew:

- UNIT_COMVisual_TEST

- UNIT_JointVisual_TEST

- UNIT_LinkFrameVisual_TEST

- UNIT_SelectionObj_TEST

- UNIT_SonarVisual_TEST

- UNIT_Visual_TEST

After trying different approaches, I ended up with a fix that adds the `rendering::load` call to tests that need rendering to be run on the same thread as the test itself. 

I did not make this the default, e.g. by introducing the call in ServerFixture like how it's done in [QTestFixture](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/edf9aedde3dc5ec9b68403651a2f55493b01ded0/gazebo/gui/QTestFixture.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#QTestFixture.cc-75), since a few sensor tests need rendering to be run in the server thread and not the test thread.

[example jenkins homebrew test report](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/691/testReport/) - various `UNIT_*Visual_TEST` test failures

[new homebrew test result](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/692/testReport/) - tests pass
values.title: Fix rendering test failures on OSX

summary.raw:
This PR fixes the following test failures on homebrew:

- UNIT_COMVisual_TEST

- UNIT_JointVisual_TEST

- UNIT_LinkFrameVisual_TEST

- UNIT_SelectionObj_TEST

- UNIT_SonarVisual_TEST

- UNIT_Visual_TEST

After trying different approaches, I ended up with a fix that adds the `rendering::load` call to tests that need rendering to be run on the same thread as the test itself. 

I did not make this the default, e.g. by introducing the call in ServerFixture like how it's done in [QTestFixture](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/edf9aedde3dc5ec9b68403651a2f55493b01ded0/gazebo/gui/QTestFixture.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#QTestFixture.cc-75), since a few sensor tests need rendering to be run in the server thread and not the test thread.

[example jenkins homebrew test report](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/691/testReport/) - various `UNIT_*Visual_TEST` test failures

[new homebrew test result](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/692/testReport/) - tests pass
summary.html:
This PR fixes the following test failures on homebrew:

  • UNIT_COMVisual_TEST

  • UNIT_JointVisual_TEST

  • UNIT_LinkFrameVisual_TEST

  • UNIT_SelectionObj_TEST

  • UNIT_SonarVisual_TEST

  • UNIT_Visual_TEST

After trying different approaches, I ended up with a fix that adds the rendering::load call to tests that need rendering to be run on the same thread as the test itself.

I did not make this the default, e.g. by introducing the call in ServerFixture like how it's done in QTestFixture, since a few sensor tests need rendering to be run in the server thread and not the test thread.

example jenkins homebrew test report - various UNIT_*Visual_TEST test failures

new homebrew test result - tests pass

values.description:
* PIMPL

* ign-math

* ~~Deprecate~~ Remove `Get`

* unboost

* ~~I was experiencing crashes when closing the building editor if I used `unique_ptr`, but it seems to work well with `shared_ptr`. I don't really understand what's going on, it would segfault trying to access the `attachedManips` vector. Maybe it's related to it being accessed from outside.~~ Moved attachment logic from `BuildingModelManip` to `BuildingMaker` so there are less pointers being moved around.

* old [CI](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/716/) happy
values.title: PIMPLize gui/building/BuildingModelManip

summary.raw:
* PIMPL

* ign-math

* ~~Deprecate~~ Remove `Get`

* unboost

* ~~I was experiencing crashes when closing the building editor if I used `unique_ptr`, but it seems to work well with `shared_ptr`. I don't really understand what's going on, it would segfault trying to access the `attachedManips` vector. Maybe it's related to it being accessed from outside.~~ Moved attachment logic from `BuildingModelManip` to `BuildingMaker` so there are less pointers being moved around.

* old [CI](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/716/) happy
summary.html:
• PIMPL

  • ign-math

  • Deprecate Remove Get

  • unboost

  • I was experiencing crashes when closing the building editor if I used unique_ptr, but it seems to work well with shared_ptr. I don't really understand what's going on, it would segfault trying to access the attachedManips vector. Maybe it's related to it being accessed from outside. Moved attachment logic from BuildingModelManip to BuildingMaker so there are less pointers being moved around.

  • old CI happy

values.description:
I did not find a way to dynamically add links to a model. I can create links via Physics::CreateLink, but they will not show up in gzclient's "world" tab and their visualization is not rendered unless they are added to a model's private "links" vector.

There used to be the same problem for joints, but someone has already added a Model::CreateJoint method. This pull request would add a corresponding Model::CreateLink method.
values.title: add a Model::CreateLink() method

summary.raw:
I did not find a way to dynamically add links to a model. I can create links via Physics::CreateLink, but they will not show up in gzclient's "world" tab and their visualization is not rendered unless they are added to a model's private "links" vector.

There used to be the same problem for joints, but someone has already added a Model::CreateJoint method. This pull request would add a corresponding Model::CreateLink method.
summary.html:
I did not find a way to dynamically add links to a model. I can create links via Physics::CreateLink, but they will not show up in gzclient's "world" tab and their visualization is not rendered unless they are added to a model's private "links" vector.

There used to be the same problem for joints, but someone has already added a Model::CreateJoint method. This pull request would add a corresponding Model::CreateLink method.

values.reason: Thanks for this contribution. I'm moving this submission to pull request #2185.
